title: Quarto Pearls
text:
Preface
This is a summary of some tips and tricks for using Quarto. It is a work in progress and I’ll just be adding to it as and when things come up. The function is to capture the things that I forgot how to do and had to Google, plus new (to me) things as I learn them, to save time RE: repeated Googles in the future.
It’s written from the perspective of using RStudio IDE on a Windows platform. Project was initiated with the following and using {renv}:

Quarto 1.4.551
RStudio 2023.12.1+402 “Ocean Storm”
Windows 10 Enterprise, Version 22H2

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

title: 3  Basics
text:
3.1 Shortcuts
Now shortcuts are easily available with Alt+Shift+K (try not to Ctrl+Shift+K with muscle memory) or via the Tools menu (Keyboard Shortcuts Help). They are also listed here. Nonetheless, I am using this space for my go-to, most useful ones (Windows only).
Render: Ctrl+Shift+K
Clear console: Ctrl+L
Next tab: Ctrl+Tab
Previous Tab: Ctrl+Shift+Tab
Can also Ctrl+Shift+.[period] and then arrow keys
